subject: Re: [junit] Constructor that contains static method
msgSnippet: Call your static method in a static initializer instead of your constructor.  The syntax is: static { // put static code here. } A static initializer is kind
messageBody:
Call your static method in a static initializer instead of your
constructor. The syntax is:

static {
// put static code here.
}

A static initializer is kind of like a constructor for the class as opposed
to a constructor for a new instance of the class.

-Phil
